title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Boil the spaghetti in salted water until al dente.
While the pasta cooks, fry the guanciale or pancetta in a pan until crisp. Turn off the heat.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs and grated Pecorino cheese together. Season generously with black pepper.
Drain the pasta, reserving a little pasta water. Immediately add the hot pasta to the pan with the meat and toss to combine.
Quickly pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta, stirring vigorously to create a creamy sauce. If it's too thick, add a splash of the reserved pasta water.
Serve immediately with an extra sprinkle of cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken breast, cut into chunks
instructions: In a bowl, mix the chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, and garam masala. Marinate for at least 1 hour.
Grill or pan-sear the chicken until cooked through. Set aside.
In a large pan, heat the oil and sauté the onion until golden brown.
Add the crushed tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Stir in the heavy cream and simmer for a few minutes.
Add the cooked chicken to the sauce and heat through. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

title: Jollof Rice
summary: A West African favorite made with rice, tomatoes, peppers, and spices.
ingredients: Salt and seasoning cubes to taste
instructions: Blend the bell peppers, scotch bonnets, tomatoes, and one onion until smooth to create the pepper base.
In a large pot, heat the oil and sauté the remaining chopped onion until fragrant.
Stir in the tomato paste and fry for 5 minutes.
Pour in the pepper base and cook for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the stew thickens.
Add the stock, curry powder, thyme, salt, and seasoning cubes. Bring to a boil.
Wash the rice and stir it into the stew. Cover the pot tightly with a lid and foil paper, then reduce the heat to low.
Cook for 30-40 minutes, or until the rice is tender and has absorbed all the liquid. Do not stir during this time.
Once cooked, stir the rice from the bottom up. Serve hot.

title: Egusi Soup
summary: A hearty soup made with ground melon seeds, leafy vegetables, and assorted meats.
ingredients: Assorted meats and fish (beef, shaki, stockfish)
1 bunch of spinach or ugu leaves, chopped
Salt and seasoning cubes to taste
instructions: Boil your assorted meats and fish with seasoning until tender. Set aside, reserving the stock.
In a pot, heat the palm oil. Add the chopped onions and fry until translucent.
Mix the ground egusi with a little water to form a thick paste. Add scoops of the paste to the hot oil and fry for about 10 minutes, stirring constantly until it forms scrambles.
Pour in the meat stock and blended peppers. Add the ground crayfish, salt, and seasoning. Stir well and bring to a boil.
Add the cooked meats and fish. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes for the flavors to meld.
Stir in the chopped spinach or ugu leaves and cook for another 3-5 minutes. Serve with a swallow of your choice.

title: Pounded Yam & Efo Riro
summary: Smooth stretchy yam served with a rich spinach and pepper stew.
ingredients: 1 large bunch of spinach (Efo Shoko), chopped
Salt and seasoning cubes to taste
instructions: For Pounded Yam: Peel, wash, and boil the yam until very soft. Pound in a mortar with a pestle until it becomes a smooth, stretchy dough.
For Efo Riro: Blend the bell peppers and scotch bonnets coarsely. Set aside.
In a pot, heat the palm oil. Add the chopped onion and Iru and sauté until fragrant.
Pour in the blended pepper mix and cook for 15 minutes.
Add the pre-cooked meats, smoked fish, crayfish, salt, and seasoning. Stir and cook for another 10 minutes.
Add the chopped spinach, stir well to combine with the sauce, and cook for 5 minutes. Be careful not to overcook the vegetables.
Serve the hot Efo Riro with the Pounded Yam.

title: Suya
summary: Spicy grilled beef skewers coated with suya spice mix, served with onions and tomatoes.
ingredients: 500g beef (sirloin or flank steak), thinly sliced
instructions: Pat the beef slices dry with a paper towel.
In a bowl, combine the Suya spice and oil to form a paste. Rub the paste generously over both sides of the beef slices.
Thread the spiced beef onto the soaked wooden skewers.
Grill on a barbecue or in an oven with a grill setting for 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve hot with fresh slices of onion and tomato.

title: Moi Moi
summary: Steamed bean pudding made from blended black-eyed peas, peppers, and spices.
ingredients: Salt and seasoning cubes to taste
instructions: Soak the peeled beans in water for about 10 minutes.
In a blender, combine the beans, bell pepper, scotch bonnet, and onion with a little water. Blend until you have a very smooth, thick batter.
Pour the batter into a bowl. Stir in the vegetable oil, salt, and seasoning cubes. Mix well.
Grease your Moi Moi containers (or use Moi Moi leaves). Pour the batter into the containers, filling them up to three-quarters full.
Add your fillings, like a slice of boiled egg or some flaked fish, to each container.
Place the containers in a pot with a little water at the bottom. Cover tightly and steam for 40-50 minutes, or until a skewer inserted comes out clean.
Allow to cool slightly before serving.

title: Akara
summary: Crispy deep-fried bean cakes, usually enjoyed with pap or bread.
instructions: Soak the peeled beans in water for at least 30 minutes.
Drain the beans and blend them with the onion and scotch bonnet pepper. Use very little water to get a thick, smooth paste.
Pour the paste into a bowl. Using a whisk or mixer, incorporate air into the batter for about 5 minutes until it is light and fluffy.
Season with salt and mix well.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep pan. Use a spoon to scoop the batter and drop it carefully into the hot oil.
Fry for a few minutes on each side until golden brown and crispy.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve hot.

title: Pepper Soup
summary: A light, spicy broth cooked with fish, chicken, or goat meat and local spices.
ingredients: 500g goat meat or catfish, cut into pieces
A handful of scent leaves (Efirin), chopped
Salt and seasoning cubes to taste
instructions: Wash the meat or fish and place it in a pot.
Add the chopped onion, seasoning cubes, salt, and enough water to cover the meat.
Bring to a boil and cook until the meat is tender.
Add the pepper soup spice mix and the chopped scotch bonnet pepper. Stir well.
Cover the pot and simmer for another 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to infuse.
Stir in the chopped scent leaves and cook for 2 more minutes.
Serve hot.
